description: A study of the Arthurian legend, from its Celtic origins through the classic medieval romances of Chretien and Malory, to Victorian adaptations of Tennyson and the Pre-Raphaelites, to contemporary novels and film. Analysis focuses on the myths characteristic forms and ideas; the errant knights adventures, the grail quest, triangulating desire, and adulterous love.
name: King Arthur Thru Ages
title: Chaucer and Ethics
